tabTitle[1]list[1]itemTitle[1]: Page layout in the application - overview
tabTitle[1]list[1]videoTitle[1]: Page layout in the application - overview
tabTitle[1]list[1]videoDescription[1]: In the first mobile feature – Page layout in the application – we will explore the arrangement of visual elements, a crucial aspect that influences the structure and user experience of the application. We'll cover key components such as the header and footer sections, the main menu, profile menu and the main content area section. Additionally, we’ll check out the logo, which should navigate users to the Home page.
tabTitle[1]list[1]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Page layout in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[2]itemTitle[1]: Page layout in the application - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[2]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the first feature, we will take a look at the layout structure from the perspective of a user, how does the user profile section in the header look when you are a logged-in or a non-logged-in user, and how do user profile pages look when you are logged-in.
tabTitle[1]list[2]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Page layout in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[3]videoDescription[1]: In the second mobile feature – Navigation in the application – we will explore the navigation menu on the left side of every Sports Hub application page and what items it consists of, namely Home, News pages, Lifestyle, Dealbook, Video and Team hub. We’ll cover categories that have subcategories (for example, the NFL sports category) and those which are static (Lifestyle, Dealbook, Video, and Team hub).
tabTitle[1]list[3]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Navigation in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[4]itemTitle[1]: Navigation in the application - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[4]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the second feature, we will take a look at how a application user can use the navigation menu to move between sports categories, subcategories, and teams news pages.
tabTitle[1]list[4]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Navigation in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[5]itemTitle[1]: Log in and sign up in the application - overview
tabTitle[1]list[5]videoDescription[1]: In the third mobile feature – Log in and sign up in the application – we will explore user personal accounts in the Sports Hub application, namely how they can create one or log in to an existing one. Additionally, we'll view the “Forgot password?” functionality.
tabTitle[1]list[5]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Log in and sign up in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[6]itemTitle[1]: Log in and sign up in the application - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[6]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the third feature, we will take a look at how application users can sign up/log in in the application using an email and how they can reset their password.
tabTitle[1]list[6]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Log in and sign up in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[7]videoDescription[1]: In the fourth mobile feature – Application languages – we will explore the available languages in the application (which are present in the bottom right corner of the main menu) and how the content of the site is translated to the language, chosen by the user.
tabTitle[1]list[8]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fourth feature, we will take a look at how users can view the application in one of the supported languages.
tabTitle[1]list[9]itemTitle[1]: View articles in the application - overview
tabTitle[1]list[9]videoDescription[1]: In the fifth mobile feature – View articles in the application – we will explore how users can view articles (that are related to a specific category or team), interact with them, and select a category in the main menu.
tabTitle[1]list[9]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - View articles in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[10]itemTitle[1]: View articles in the application - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[10]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fifth feature, we will take a look at how users can view an article page, see a section with more articles from the same category that the opened article, and open a category or team page.
tabTitle[1]list[10]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - View articles in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[11]itemTitle[1]: Home page in the application - overview
tabTitle[1]list[11]videoDescription[1]: In the sixth mobile feature – Home page in the application – we will explore the main page of the Sports Hub application, which contains the most recent news, topics and page sections, such as Main Articles, Breakdown, and Photo of the day (all of which are configured by the admin).
tabTitle[1]list[11]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Home page in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[12]itemTitle[1]: Home page in the application - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[12]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the sixth feature, we will cover how a user can see the Main articles, Breakdown and Photo of the day sections on the Home page.
tabTitle[1]list[12]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Home page in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[13]itemTitle[1]: Social networks in the application - overview
tabTitle[1]list[13]videoDescription[1]: In the seventh mobile feature – Social networks on the application – we will explore how application users can use social networks to log in and sign up to the site, follow Sports Hub, share an article, and view/like Facebook posts and videos.
tabTitle[1]list[13]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Social networks in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[14]itemTitle[1]: Social networks in the application - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[14]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the seventh feature, we will cover how users can follow Sports Hub on the social networks, sign up/log in using a third-party authentication provider, and share Sports Hub articles on personal social network accounts.
tabTitle[1]list[14]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Social networks in the application:
tabTitle[1]list[15]videoDescription[1]: In the eighth mobile feature – Application footer – we will explore the footer section and its three sections: Company info, Contributors, Newsletter, as well as the Sports Hub logo, the copyright sign, and the Privacy and Terms links. Additionally, we’ll see what links should be present in the Company info and Contributors columns.
tabTitle[1]list[16]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eighth feature, we will cover how site users can see the footer on every page of the application and the elements that are present it in.
tabTitle[2]list[1]videoDescription[1]: In the ninth mobile feature – Global application search – we will explore the global application search, located in the header section, that should show all the places where the match with the entered word(s) is found.
tabTitle[2]list[2]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the ninth feature, we will cover how application users can use the global search to look for the information they’re interested in.
tabTitle[2]list[3]videoDescription[1]: In the tenth mobile feature – Comments block – we will explore the comments block, that allows users to leave comments on articles/videos, reply to other user’s comments, edit and delete their comments, and like/dislike comments.
tabTitle[2]list[4]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the tenth feature, we will cover how site users can leave comments on the article page and like/dislike other user’s comments.
tabTitle[2]list[5]itemTitle[1]: The most popular and commented articles - overview
tabTitle[2]list[5]videoDescription[1]: In the eleventh mobile feature – The most popular and commented articles  – we will explore the Most popular and Most commented sections that contain most popular and most commented articles in the application.
tabTitle[2]list[5]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - The most popular and commented articles:
tabTitle[2]list[6]itemTitle[1]: The most popular and commented articles - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[6]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eleventh feature, we will cover how application users can view the articles in the Most popular and Most commented sections.
tabTitle[2]list[6]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - The most popular and commented articles:
tabTitle[2]list[7]videoDescription[1]: In the twelfth mobile feature – Lifestyle and Dealbook news – we will explore the news from Lifestyle and Dealbook section. The Lifestyle section contains news about the daily life of sports stars and teams, and the Dealbook section is about financial deals in the sports world, such as transfer of players and rewards.
tabTitle[2]list[7]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Lifestyle and Dealbook news:
tabTitle[2]list[8]itemTitle[1]: Lifestyle and Dealbook news - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[8]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twelfth feature, we will cover how application users can visit and read the news in the Lifestyle and Dealbook sections.
tabTitle[2]list[8]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Lifestyle and Dealbook news:
tabTitle[2]list[9]videoDescription[1]: In the thirteenth mobile feature – Sports videos – we will explore the Video menu item, that should contain videos (including most popular and most commented ones) and several sections.
tabTitle[2]list[10]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the thirteenth feature, we will cover how application users can view videos and share them on their social networks.
tabTitle[2]list[11]videoDescription[1]: In the fourteenth mobile feature – User personal cabinet – we will explore the personal cabinet of a user where they can view and update their personal info.
tabTitle[2]list[12]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fourteenth feature, we will cover how users can update their personal information in their personal cabinet and update their password.
tabTitle[2]list[13]itemTitle[1]: Team hub: news about favorite teams - overview
tabTitle[2]list[13]videoDescription[1]: In the fifteenth mobile feature – Team hub: news about favorite teams – we will explore how registered users can customize their Team hub page to see news related to their favorite team(-s) or, in case they haven’t selected their favorite team, news about the team from their geolocation.
tabTitle[2]list[13]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Team hub: news about favorite teams:
tabTitle[2]list[14]itemTitle[1]: Team hub: news about favorite teams - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[14]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fifteenth feature, we will cover how users can select their favorite teams, see news about their favorite teams on the Team hub page, or see news about teams from their geolocation in case they haven’t selected their favorite teams.
tabTitle[2]list[14]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Team hub: news about favorite teams:
tabTitle[2]list[15]itemTitle[1]: News from Sports Hub partners - overview
tabTitle[2]list[15]videoDescription[1]: In the sixteenth mobile feature – News from Sports Hub partners – we will explore the news from partners, which should be configured by admin and be shown on appropriate pages.
tabTitle[2]list[15]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - News from Sports Hub partners:
tabTitle[2]list[16]itemTitle[1]: News from Sports Hub partners - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[16]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the sixteenth feature, we will cover how users can view news from configured partners in the appropriate categories.
tabTitle[2]list[16]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - News from Sports Hub partners:
tabTitle[2]list[17]videoDescription[1]: In the seventeenth mobile feature – Newsletter subscription – we will explore how site users can subscribe and then receive daily news emails from the Sports Hub site, that will be based on subscription type (a subscription to a specific sports category/subcategory/team page or to the Home page).
tabTitle[2]list[18]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the seventeenth feature, we will cover how users can subscribe to the Sports Hub site to receive an email with the latest sports news and how they can navigate from their email to the application.
tabTitle[2]list[19]videoDescription[1]: In the eighteenth mobile feature – Banners in the application – we will explore the banners that should be related to the category that the user is viewing. Additionally, we will look at the predefined banners for Facebook Video, Facebook Post, Lifestyle and Dealbook.
tabTitle[2]list[19]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Banners in the application:
tabTitle[2]list[20]itemTitle[1]: Banners in the application - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[20]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eighteenth feature, we will cover how users can view banners, as well as predefined Lifestyle, Dealbook and Facebook banners after the main page content.
tabTitle[2]list[20]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Banners in the application:
tabTitle[2]list[21]videoDescription[1]: In the nineteenth mobile feature – Advertisements – we will explore category-related advertisements that should be at the top of banners after the main content of the page.
tabTitle[2]list[22]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the nineteenth feature, we will cover how users can view advertisements on the top of banners after the main content of the page.
tabTitle[2]list[23]videoDescription[1]: In the twentieth mobile feature – Surveys – we will explore surveys, that help collect information from sports fans and build statistics.
tabTitle[2]list[24]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twentieth feature, we will cover how users can see the list of all surveys and participate in surveys in their personal cabinet.
